lessons.japanese: 雨にも関わらずゴルフをした。
lessons.english: We played golf in spite of the rain.

lessons.japanese: わたしは彼の欠点にも関わらずやはり彼が好きだ。
lessons.english: I do not love him the less for his faults.

lessons.japanese: それにも関わらず彼は試験に合格することができた。
lessons.english: And yet he could pass the exam.

lessons.japanese: 貧しいにも関わらず、彼は幸せだった。
lessons.english: Even though he was poor, he was happy.

lessons.japanese: 彼女の抗議にも関わらず彼は行った。
lessons.english: Although she kept protesting, he went.

lessons.japanese: 彼女の欠点にも関わらず、私は彼女を愛している。
lessons.english: I love her none the less for her faults.

lessons.japanese: 彼女の欠点にも関わらず、私は彼女が好きです。
lessons.english: With all her faults, I like her.

lessons.japanese: 彼女の警告にも関わらず、彼はそのことを軽んじた。
lessons.english: Despite her warning, he made little of the matter.

lessons.japanese: 彼は貧乏にも関わらず、そのテストに合格した。
lessons.english: He passed the test in the face of poverty.

lessons.japanese: 彼は病気だったにも関わらず仕事に出かけた。
lessons.english: He went to work in spite of his illness.

lessons.japanese: 彼は努力をしたにも関わらず、事業に失敗した。
lessons.english: He failed in his business in spite of his efforts.

lessons.japanese: 彼は大きな危険にも関わらず成功した。
lessons.english: He succeeded in the face of great danger.
